text: On which of the following frequencies are General class licensees prohibited from operating as control operator?
With which of the following conditions must beacon stations comply?
choices: No more than one beacon station may transmit in the same band from the same station location
The frequency must be coordinated with the National Beacon Organization
The frequency must be posted on the internet or published in a national periodical

text: What is the maximum symbol rate permitted for RTTY or data emission transmissions on the 10-meter band?
How long is a Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) valid for exam element credit?
choices: For as long as your current license is valid

text: Why should an amateur operator normally avoid transmitting on 14.100, 18.110, 21.150, 24.930 and 28.200 MHz?
choices: A system of propagation beacon stations operates on those frequencies
A system of automatic digital stations operates on those frequencies┬á
These frequencies are set aside for emergency operations
These frequencies are set aside for bulletins from the FCC

text: Generally, who should respond to a station in the contiguous 48 states calling ΓÇ£CQ DXΓÇ¥?
choices: Any caller is welcome to respond
Any stations outside the lower 48 states

text: When selecting an SSB transmitting frequency, what minimum separation should be used to minimize interference to stations on adjacent frequencies?
Which of the following describes full break-in CW operation (QSK)?
choices: Breaking stations send the Morse code prosign ΓÇ£BKΓÇ¥
Automatic keyers, instead of hand keys, are used to send Morse code
An operator must activate a manual send/receive switch before and after every transmission
Transmitting stations can receive between code characters and elements

text: Why do many amateurs keep a station log?
choices: The FCC requires a log of all international contacts
The FCC requires a log of all international third-party traffic
The log provides evidence of operation needed to renew a license without retest
To help with a reply if the FCC requests information about your station

text: What is the primary purpose of an Amateur Radio Emergency Data Network (AREDN) mesh network?
choices: To provide FM repeater coverage in remote areas
To provide real time propagation data by monitoring amateur radio transmissions worldwide
To provide high-speed data services during an emergency or community event
To provide DX spotting reports to aid contesters and DXers

text: What does the K-index measure?
choices: The relative position of sunspots on the surface of the Sun
The short-term stability of EarthΓÇÖs geomagnetic field
The short-term stability of the SunΓÇÖs magnetic field
The solar radio flux at Boulder, Colorado

text: What happens to HF propagation when the LUF exceeds the MUF?
choices: Propagation via ordinary skywave communications is not possible over that path
HF communications over the path are enhanced
Double-hop propagation along the path is more common
Propagation over the path on all HF frequencies is enhanced

text: Why is long-distance communication on the 40-, 60-, 80-, and 160-meter bands more difficult during the day?
choices: The F region absorbs signals at these frequencies during daylight hours
The F region is unstable during daylight hours
The D region absorbs signals at these frequencies during daylight hours
The E region is unstable during daylight hours

text: How does a noise blanker work?
choices: By redirecting noise pulses into a filter capacitor
By reducing receiver gain during a noise pulse

text: What signals are used to conduct a two-tone test?
choices: Two audio signals of the same frequency shifted 90 degrees
Two audio frequency range square wave signals of equal amplitude

text: How can the effects of ground loops be minimized?
choices: Connect all ground conductors in series
Connect the AC neutral conductor to the ground wire
Avoid using lock washers and star washers when making ground connections

text: What does an S meter measure?
Why should DC power for a 100-watt HF transceiver not be supplied by a vehicleΓÇÖs auxiliary power socket?
choices: The socket is not wired with an RF-shielded power cable
The socketΓÇÖs wiring may be inadequate for the current drawn by the transceiver
The DC polarity of the socket is reversed from the polarity of modern HF transceivers
Drawing more than 50 watts from this socket could cause the engine to overheat

text: What is reactance?
choices: Opposition to the flow of direct current caused by resistance
Opposition to the flow of alternating current caused by capacitance or inductance
Reinforcement of the flow of direct current caused by resistance
Reinforcement of the flow of alternating current caused by capacitance or inductance

text: What is the output PEP of an unmodulated carrier if the average power is 1060 watts?
What transformer turns ratio matches an antennaΓÇÖs 600-ohm feed point impedance to a 50-ohm coaxial cable?
Which of the following is characteristic of low voltage ceramic capacitors?
What is meant by the term MMIC?
Which symbol in figure G7-1 represents an NPN junction transistor?
In a Class A amplifier, what percentage of the time does the amplifying device conduct?
What term specifies a filterΓÇÖs maximum ability to reject signals outside its passband?
What emission is produced by a reactance modulator connected to a transmitter RF amplifier stage?
What is the term for interference from a signal at twice the IF frequency from the desired signal?
Which is true of mesh network microwave nodes?
choices: Having more nodes increases signal strengths
If one node fails, a packet may still reach its target station via an alternate node
Links between two nodes in a network may have different frequencies and bandwidths
More nodes reduce overall microwave out of band interference

text: How does the attenuation of coaxial cable change with increasing frequency?
choices: Attenuation follows MarconiΓÇÖs Law of Attenuation

text: Where should the radial wires of a ground-mounted vertical antenna system be placed?
choices: As high as possible above the ground
On the surface or buried a few inches below the ground
At the center of the antenna

text: What is the approximate length of the driven element of a Yagi antenna?
What is the primary use of a Beverage antenna?
choices: Directional receiving for MF and low HF bands
Directional transmitting for low HF bands
Portable direction finding at higher HF frequencies
Portable direction finding at lower HF frequencies

text: What precaution should be taken if you install an indoor transmitting antenna?
choices: Locate the antenna close to your operating position to minimize feed-line radiation
Position the antenna along the edge of a wall to reduce parasitic radiation
Make sure that MPE limits are not exceeded in occupied areas
Make sure the antenna is properly shielded

text: Which size of fuse or circuit breaker would be appropriate to use with a circuit that uses AWG number 14 wiring?
